author: CNA
title: WhatsApp says Russia is trying to block it - CNA
text:
MOSCOW: WhatsApp said Russia was trying to block its services because the social media messaging app owned by Meta Platforms offered people's right to secure communication, and vowed to continue trying to make encrypted services available in Russia.
Russia has started restricting some Telegram and WhatsApp calls , accusing the foreign-owned platforms of failing to share information with law enforcement in fraud and terrorism cases.
"WhatsApp is private, end-to-end encrypted, and defies government attempts to violate people's right to secure communication, which is why Russia is trying to block it from over 100 million Russian people," WhatsApp said in a statement.
"We will keep doing all we can to make end-to-end encrypted communication available to people everywhere, including in Russia."
Related: Putin authorises creation of state messaging app to combat WhatsApp and Telegram Russian lawmakers say 'security threat' WhatsApp should prepare to leave Russia Telegram said its moderators were using AI tools to monitor public parts of the platform to remove millions of malicious messages every day.
"Telegram actively combats harmful use of its platform including calls for sabotage or violence and fraud," Telegram said in a statement.
Russia has clashed with foreign tech platforms for several years over content and data storage in a simmering dispute that intensified after Moscow's sent its army into Ukraine in February 2022, with critics saying that Russia is trying to expand its control over the country's internet space.
Source: Reuters/ec Sign up for our newsletters Get our pick of top stories and thought-provoking articles in your inbox

author: /cronologia/-/meta/edwin-ordonez
title: Shin Fujiyama corri√≥ 250 kil√≥metros para reconstruir escuela de Tegucigalpa
text: TEGUCIGALPA, HONDURAS.‚Äî 250 kil√≥metros, 13 d√≠as y una meta de 2.7 millones de lempiras tiene un solo objetivo: reconstruir la Escuela Experimental de la Universidad Nacional Aut√≥noma de Honduras y beneficiar a los actuales 238 ni√±os y el futuro de los que est√°n por ingresar al centro educativo con 32 a√±os de ense√±anza en aulas de l√°minas de panelit. En una visita a la UNAH, el [influencer japon√©s Shin Fujiyama](https://www.facebook.com/realshinfujiyama) quer√≠a conocer un poco sobre lo que realizan los empleados, pero su objetivo fue m√°s all√° al ver la deplorable condici√≥n en la que se encontraban las aulas del espacio de ense√±anza en el interior de la UNAH. La carrera de altruista que arranc√≥ desde Chamelec√≥n, San Pedro Sula, Cort√©s, se volvi√≥ un s√≠mbolo de solidaridad y ha movilizado desde las personas de m√°s bajos recursos hasta empresas reconocidas que le han dado una mano amiga al influencer de la Educaci√≥n. Con botellones en mano, los colaboradores del fil√°ntropo lo acompa√±aron por todo el recorrido y cientos se acercaron a colaborar, sin embargo, Shin tambi√©n recibi√≥ la ayuda de grandes empresas y Tiktoker, quien anunci√≥, ayer, que transfiri√≥ m√°s de 20,000 d√≥lares a la fundaci√≥n One Thousand Schools, que fund√≥ hace 20 a√±os el influencer. Aunque hasta ahora es la donaci√≥n m√°s significativa, hay Mipymes y grandes empresas que se han sumado al reto y dar√°n material a para la obra, adem√°s de sumas de dinero en efectivo que ayudar√°n a Fujiyama a terminar su misi√≥n: Construir 1000 escuelas en Honduras. Entre algunos donativos significativos est√°n el que hizo la Secretar√≠a de Seguridad con 200 mil, Banco Atl√°ntida 100,000 y los 500 mil de [Carlos Eduardo Espino](https://www.elheraldo.hn/entretenimiento/influencer-carlos-eduardo-espina-dona-20-mil-dolares-carrera-shin-fujiyama-reconstruir-escuela-expermental-unah-honduras-MN18734822), 50,000 Octavio Pineda, 50,000 de Larach y Cia. Adem√°s, est√°n los donativos de particulares que impulsan la obra de solidaridad, lo que se estima que el influencer habr√≠a alcanzado y superado, hasta ahora, la meta, lo que le ayudar√° a continuar con la construcci√≥n de m√°s escuelas en todo el pa√≠s. 13 d√≠as de perseverancia En su 13 d√≠as de carrera, Shin Fujiyama llegar√° hoy a la Universidad Nacional Aut√≥noma de Honduras, donde lo espera una multitud para darle las gracias por su proyecci√≥n en beneficio de los ni√±os del Distrito Central. A lo largo de su recorrido por la carretera CA-5, desde San Pedro Sula hasta Tegucigalpa, el japon√©s con coraz√≥n de hondure√±o se ha rodeado de catrachos y extranjeros inspirados y motivados en sumarse a esta marat√≥n por la educaci√≥n de la ni√±ez. Ayer, cada vez m√°s cerca de la meta, su parada fue en el sector entre la aldea El Lolo y la colonia El Carrizal, en el puente peatonal blanco que da la bienvenida a Tegucigalpa. En este pen√∫ltimo tramo, que arranc√≥ con una fresca ma√±ana desde T√°mara, se vio acompa√±ado de elementos de la Polic√≠a Nacional, ni√±os, adolescentes y otros personajes que generan contenido para redes sociales. Rumbo a la meta El influencer sali√≥ hoy a las 6:30 de la ma√±ana desde el puente peatonal de la colonia El Carrizal. Luego la ruta se desvi√≥ por el anillo perif√©rico a la altura de Ciudad del √Ångel, por esta v√≠a se recorrer√°n unos 19 kil√≥metros hasta llegar al t√∫nel y puente que conecta con el bulevar Centroam√©rica que pasa frente a la colonia Kennedy. Se contin√∫a por este bulevar hasta llegar a la esquina del Centro C√≠vico Gubernamental, donde se doblar√° al bulevar Juan Pablo II, para hacer una parada en uno de los principales patrocinadores de esta actividad. Se avanzar√° para tomar el bulevar La Hacienda y conectarse al bulevar Suyapa, para avanzar hasta la Bas√≠lica y as√≠ llegar, tras 13 d√≠as, a la meta en la UNAH. Se tienen programadas varias actividades y reconocimientos para los participantes.

author: FOX 2 Staff
title: Couple with three kids & infant lead Detroit police chase, run into abandoned home
text:
DETROIT (FOX 2) - Michigan State Police have released video of a chase in Detroit from Wednesday where two adults ran from police ‚Äì and were spotted running into an abandoned home with three young children.
MSP said it was called to help Detroit Police track down the driver of a Jeep that ran from a traffic stop.
The helicopter picked up the Jeep driving south on Woodrow Wilson before the car turned east onto Webb and crossed over tot he other side of the Lodge.
Video from MSP cut to the vehicle pulling up in front of an abandoned home. The night vision from MSP's chopper showed three young children climbing out of the car and running towards the home.
Police did not say where the home was located.
Along with the three children who ran into the home, police also spotted one of the adults pulling an infant in a car seat from the vehicle. In the video from MSP, an officer can be heard calling to have the baby checked out as a precaution.
"These suspects showed no regard for the safety of the children in the car or those driving around them. Great work by our pilots and DPD to take these suspects into custody without anyone getting hurt," MSP Lt. Mike Shaw said.
Michigan State Police said a two adults with young kids led a police chase -- and eventually ran inside of an abandoned home with the children.

author: /cronologia/-/meta/carlitos-giron
title: 7 departamentos de Honduras en alerta verde por frente fr√≠o
text: TEGUCIGALPA, HONDURAS.- Debido al ingreso de un frente fr√≠o y una vaguada al territorio hondure√±o que dejar√° fuertes lluvias y bajas temperaturas, la [Secretar√≠a de Gesti√≥n de Riesgos y Contigencias Nacionales (Copeco)](https://twitter.com/CopecoHonduras1/status/1740455347377328264) emiti√≥ esta tarde alerta verde en siete departamentos del pa√≠s. Y nuevamente ser√≠a la zona norte de Honduras la m√°s afectada. Los departamentos declarados en alerta son: Islas de la Bah√≠a, Santa B√°rbara, Yoro, Atl√°ntida, Cort√©s, Col√≥n y Gracias a Dios. Estas alertas fueron emitidas por un per√≠odo de 72 horas a partir de hoy jueves desde las 12 del mediod√≠a. Seg√∫n explic√≥ Copeco, las fuertes lluvias que comenzaron ayer provocar√≠a ‚Äúposibles inundaciones urbanas y desbordamientos de los r√≠os que nacen en las sierras de Omoa, Merend√≥n, Mico Quemado, Nombre de Dios, La Esperanza y Sico, as√≠ como alto oleaje en la costa norte del pa√≠s‚Äù. Los mayores acumulados se registrar√≠an en las monta√±as del norte y noroccidente con acumulados de hasta 200 a 250 mil√≠metros (mm) diarios los d√≠as viernes y s√°bado y se advierte de vientos racheados que podr√≠an alcanzar los 60 kil√≥metros por hora sobre las planicies del sur. Este es el sexto frente fr√≠o de la temporada 2023-2024 y a√∫n quedan en proyecciones al menos 8 de estos fen√≥menos climatol√≥gicos. Los frentes fr√≠os anteriores dejaron grandes disturbios y muertes en la zona norte de Honduras. Periodista digital desde 2021, con recorrido en periodismo de datos, profundidad y de investigaci√≥n. Tambi√©n con experiencia en cr√≥nicas futbol√≠sticas y otros deportes.

author: Whitney Burney
title: Dearborn Heights at risk of city shutdown impacting police, fire, trash pickup
text:
By Whitney Burney ,
19 minutes ago The city of Dearborn Heights is facing a total shutdown in the coming days if city leaders are unable to pass a budget.
City council began mulling over the budget back in April but has been unable to come to an agreement with the Mayor on spending for the next fiscal year.
If the budget is not passed by July 1st, there will be impacts to city employee pay - including police and fire. Senior and youth recreation services will be canceled and residents will not have trash pickup. Public works services, the city‚Äôs telephone system, its website, and cable TV channel will also be shut down.
"Everything is at stake," said Mayor Bill Bazzi. " I cannot operate the city with no budget. So, I have to shut the city down. Everything."
WXYZ Mayor Bazzi and members of city council have slightly differing opinions on the impasse preventing the budget from passing.
Bazzi says he believes there is an underlying personal issue. He says council members have a new ask every time they come to the table to negotiate budget terms.
RELATED STORY: Dearborn Heights City Council, leadership at odds over Mayor's no confidence vote
Dearborn Heights City Council, leadership at odds over Mayor's no confidence vote "We‚Äôve supplied everything. We‚Äôve done everything that they‚Äôve asked for and they‚Äôre just certain council members who don‚Äôt want to approve the budget," Bazzi said.
The Mayor says in the last two sessions, the budget presented included surpluses of $9,682 and $1,160 respectively. However, city council voted not to approve either budget, instead asking for W2s from all city employees which Bazzi believes violates federal law.
"We‚Äôre asking for W2s and most recent pay stubs redacting all private information. (Bazzi) brought an attorney that said it is okay to give information to city council if it is official city business. We‚Äôre about to make a budget vote. This is official city business," said City Council Chair Mo Baydoun.
WXYZ Baydoun says they only asked for the employee financial information after finding discrepancies in spending on the part of the mayor. Baydoun says the council found information that the mayor authorized bonuses and raises for some city employees without approval from council which is illegal. The council chair says they want the documents to confirm any other potential unsanctioned spending.
"The council has been working with this administration tirelessly but what we don‚Äôt want and what‚Äôs not acceptable is for the administration to continue to spend money without the approval of this council," said Baydoun. "Fundamentals of legislative and executive branch 101: we know money cannot be spent without approval from the legislative body. That goes for the federal, the president doesn‚Äôt do it. the governor doesn‚Äôt do it, the county executive doesn‚Äôt do it. Why does the mayor of Dearborn Heights think that he can bend the rules?"
City residents say the budget issue is concerning.
"It‚Äôs really disappointing. It‚Äôs sad to see such division in city hall when my elected representatives are there to serve us and work together to get the job done and I think that‚Äôs what most residents want," said Rachel LaPointe who lives in Dearborn Heights.
WXYZ A lifelong resident, LaPointe tunes in for almost every city council meeting and after going through public documents on her own says she thinks council may have valid concerns of inappropriate spending.
"I think there‚Äôs very solid evidence of that having happened. Council is not lying about that. The mayor needs to own up to what‚Äôs been done in the past and commit to doing the right thing moving forward," said LaPointe.
LaPointe says she remains hopeful the city will be able to avoid the shutdown.
"I‚Äôm confident that city council is going to pass something. I know that they take this seriously and they are very serious about making sure services are not interrupted," said LaPointe.
7 News Detroit is still working to independently confirm alleged unsanctioned spending by Mayor Bazzi. Bazzi was not immediately available for additional comment Thursday afternoon.
A special meeting is scheduled for Friday, June 28th at 5 p.m. Baydoun says he plans to present a new budget at that time.
If council is unable to pass a budget, employees will officially be furloughed on Monday, July 1st and city services will be suspended at midnight on July 1st.

author: Carmen Hern√°ndez
title: A la baja los incendios en Veracruz: Sedema
text:
XALAPA, Ver., 16 de enero de 2024.- El secretario de Medio Ambiente, Juan Carlos Contreras Bautista, inform√≥ que Veracruz va a la baja en lo que se refiere a los incendios forestales; en 2023 registraron menos conflagraciones en comparaci√≥n con el 2022.
En entrevista previa a la ceremonia de inicio de la Temporada de Incendios Forestales 2024‚Äù, el funcionario estatal destac√≥ que las acciones coordinadas entre estado y federaci√≥n se han logrado este resultado.
Record√≥ que durante 2023 se registr√≥ una afectaci√≥n de superficie quemada menor a la del a√±o anterior, sin embargo, en 2022 se registr√≥ adem√°s menos afectaci√≥n que en 2021, por lo que reiter√≥ que estos siniestros forestales van a la baja en el territorio veracruzano.
‚ÄúEn 2023 fue menor que 2022 y el 2022 fue menor que 2021, vamos a la baja, esto ha sido por la participaci√≥n de todos, igual con la participaci√≥n de los presidentes municipales‚Äù.
Por lo anterior, dijo que actualmente se aplican diversas acciones, as√≠ como estrategias conjuntas con la Conafor y los ayuntamientos de la regi√≥n de Perote para evitar incendios en esa zona.
‚ÄúEl objetivo es preservar la superficie y la vegetaci√≥n, as√≠ como mantener la inercia a la baja en lo que se refiere a la generaci√≥n, as√≠ como propagaci√≥n de incendios forestales, por lo que trabajan los tres √≥rdenes de gobierno‚Äù.

author: Nuclear Decommissioning Authority
title: NDA group employees honoured by His Majesty the King - GOV.UK
text:
Two NDA group employees have been awarded honours by His Majesty the King in the New Year‚Äôs Honours List, for services to the nuclear industry, young people and their local communities.
Michelle Pearse, Nuclear Decommissioning Authority Quality & Business Support Manager, has been awarded a BEM (British Empire Medal) and Peter Buchan, Nuclear Transport Solutions Managing Director of Shipping, has received an MBE (Member of the Order of the British Empire).
NDA Group Chief Executive David Peattie said:
I‚Äôm sure colleagues across the NDA group will join me in congratulating Michelle and Pete on this well-deserved recognition, both have made significant contributions to the nuclear industry and society.
Our people are our most important asset, and we are proud to have one of the most knowledgeable and experienced nuclear workforces in the world, who go above and beyond for their colleagues and their community, while also continuing to deliver our mission safely, securely and sustainably.
Michelle has worked for the NDA since 2005 in a number of roles. The hard work of her whole team, along with her pastoral support, leadership, and empathy, had a huge impact on the NDA being able to return to normal operations at a rapid pace following the start of the pandemic.
In addition to her day job, Michelle has also fulfilled a voluntary role with the Changing Lives Learning Trust in West Cumbria since 2012, a not-for-profit charity that manages sponsored secondary and primary academies.
Under her guidance as Chair from 2019, the Trust has gone from strength to strength, and this has had a big impact on the educational sector in West Cumbria.
Michelle said:
I am overwhelmed and delighted on receiving this honour. I can‚Äôt wait to tell my parents! This has never happened to anyone in our family before so it‚Äôll be a lot to take in.
The business support team are kind and supportive of each other and they work really hard. I care for them, all of them, including what is happening in their personal lives as that can have a huge impact on them day to day.
I am so proud of my work with the Trust, it‚Äôs very rewarding giving back to the children and the communities they live in. I‚Äôm very grateful to the NDA for giving me the space to work with them and develop myself at the same time.
Pete‚Äôs career spans over 32 years and in that time he has played a key role in the NDA group‚Äôs international business and ensuring the world-wide safe transport and storage of nuclear materials from across the globe.
He worked to ensure the largest civilian move of plutonium powder and highly-enriched uranium was safely completed when it was shipped from Japan to the USA. This transport operation was an important milestone in global efforts to secure nuclear materials, and reduce the risk of nuclear proliferation.
Speaking of his pride at receiving the honour Pete said:
I was shocked when I received the letter and it took a while to sink in as I didn‚Äôt think I would be worthy of such an award.
It‚Äôs a privilege to work in this industry, and when I think back to joining as a graduate all those years ago, never did I think this would happen to me.
I‚Äôve worked on some fantastic and challenging projects that have made a real difference to global nuclear safety and security, and for this to be recognised at the highest levels is such an honour.
This wouldn‚Äôt have been possible without my brilliant colleagues. Throughout my career I‚Äôve worked with some of the most dedicated, committed and intelligent people in the industry and I just want to thank them all for their help over the years.

author: Caren Lissner
title: Northern Lights Spotted All Around New Jersey Thursday
text: [Weather](/new-jersey/hoboken/weather) Northern Lights Spotted All Around New Jersey Thursday Patch has already gotten photos from people as far south as Cherry Hill. The Northern Lights display is likely to peak after 11 p.m. NORTH JERSEY, NJ ‚Äî Photographers and skywatchers across New Jersey sent photos to Patch of the Northern Lights, a celestial display that's expected to peak after 11 p.m. tonight and possibly tomorrow night. The colorful smears of light were briefly visible in the Garden State around 7:30 p.m. The National Weather Service in Mt. Holly shared this photo around 7:15 p.m. Commenters from across the state weighed in with photos they took of the colorful skies. Find out what's happening in Hobokenwith free, real-time updates from Patch. ü§© Here is our view of the aurora borealis (northern lights from our office around 7:15 PM! What are you seeing at your location?[pic.twitter.com/F4DiNKaDsQ] ‚Äî NWS Mount Holly (@NWS_MountHolly)[October 10, 2024] Cloud cover and light pollution can play into the ability to view the lights. Sometimes, they can't be seen with the naked eye, but can be caught on camera with a slow shutter speed. The display of lights, also called aurora borealis, has been appearing to the naked eye in Canada and northern parts of the U.S. this year because the sun is at the peak of an 11-year cycle. During this "solar maximum," heightened geomagnetic storming increases the chances of seeing the aurora south of its usual Arctic range. Find out what's happening in Hobokenwith free, real-time updates from Patch. With more people on social media than back in 2013, and more reading news sites and using apps such as Aurora, the word has been spreading rapidly about the brilliant display, which some wait all their lives to see. 'Extreme' Levels Possible The National Weather Service is predicting that the solar activity causing the Northern Lights will increase late Thursday into Friday. The Kp index could reach as high as 8.33 after sundown Thursday well into Friday. "The greatest observed 3 hr Kp over the past 24 hours was 5 (NOAA Scale G1)," [the NWS said](https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/communities/aurora-dashboard-experimental). "The greatest expected 3 hr Kp for Oct 10-Oct 12 2024 is 8.33 (NOAA Scale G4)." The auroral strength is measured by the Kp index, according to the Space Weather Prediction Center. In general, the chances of seeing the lights are best with a Kp index of at least 5, The Washington Post wrote in a story about aurora borealis tourism. Chances of seeing northern lights generally increase around the fall equinox, when the sun produces a surplus of geomagnetic storms ‚Äî almost twice the annual average ‚Äî but this fall and the coming year should be especially spectacular as Solar Cycle 25 reaches its peak, which NOAA predicts will occur from November through March 2026. Patch Editor Michele Rotuno-Johnson contributed to this story. Get more local news delivered straight to your inbox. [Sign up for free Patch newsletters and alerts.](/new-jersey/hoboken/subscribe)
